page.title: 16Royal Grammar School, G'ford
page.content:
In 1552 King Edward VI ordered that there was to be a "grammar school in Guildford for the education, institution and instruction of boys and youths in grammar at all future times for ever to endure". The school now consists of two main buildings on opposite sides of the High Street. The new building was built in 1962.
The old building has a chained library dating from 1648 containing old and valuable books. They originally belonged to Bishop Parkhurst. They are chained because the library was once open to the public and did not have a librarian.
The school is noted for its sport, especially cricket and rugby. The rugby team toured New Zealand in 1985.
